channel.title: Daterbaces and random picking of set numbers?
channel.description:
hay evry one im writing a quick program that if you enter a id cose and then a pw code you get a pw for somthing els
rite now i want to no how can i write a db that will hold members id's and pw's in so that if thay type them in and click enter and there corect then it will display what i have programd it to if thay get there "log in" so to say correct in just useing the java.utill for this program and to get evrything working i wrote... [code] if (var1 == var2) bla bla
else bla bla [/code]
i would like to also no if i wanted a over rite (witch ive allready programd in) witch if i enterd a sertan code into the first id box. (the part i need help with) then it would tell me a 4 digit code eg 1234 and then i would have another uneek code that asind to that 4 digit code.
id need like lets say 10 of those 4 digits codes with diff 5 digit codes asined to eatch of them so if i overrited the system by typing in the ststic 4 dig code itll tell me a random 4 digit code picked outa the 10 and then i would have to no the 5 digit code to go with that if i get it write then itll print a statment
if eny one could assist me with this id be more than happy for your help thanks n00b1 p.s sorry for my speling i have a prob with it

item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

ok dude ill do it in a sec just gota install txt pad again on to my laptop just got it back XD[br][size=1]Posted at: November 13, 2006, 02:49:34 PM[/size][hr]ok here i go it will probley confews you way more lol sorry if it dose just try an dwork it out it should still compile and the code underneeth is just an eg it will NOT work
here we go

[code]
//imports------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
import java.util.*;
//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
public class Bull1
{
public static void main (String[] args)
{
//varibles--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
int var1 = 0; //the user id
int var2 = 0; //the users password
int var3 = 0; //the 5 digit code assind to the 4 digit one
int Manover = 5990; //the manual override code
int pw = 83520; // the system password
int de = 1234; //the 4digit code randomley picked outof a list
//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
System.out.print(“what is your user id? :”);
var1 = input.nextInt();

		if (var1 == Manover)
		System.out.print("you have overwrited the system.

the defalt pass set is " + de + " please type it in: ");
if (var1 == Manover)
var3 = input.nextInt();

		if (var3 == de)
		System.out.println("

hello the pass is " + pw + "
hope you got that");

		else
		System.out.print("what is your user p.w.? :");
		var2 = input.nextInt();

		if (var2 == var1)
		System.out.println("

hello the pass is " + pw + "
hope you got that
");

		else
		System.out.print("no chance

");
}
}
// here ill just rite a sort of function of things it wont work as code but it will give you an ida of what i want

the defalt pass set is " + de + " please type it in: ");
if (var1 == Manover)
var3 = input.nextInt();

hello the pass is " + pw + "
hope you got that");

hello the pass is " + pw + "

item.title: Daterbaces and random picking of set numbers?
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

Still sort of confused as to what you want it to do…I’ve sort of tried to clean up your code but your variables are sort of hard to follow. so rename var1 to userID, var2 to ???, var3 to ???, and write some psuedo-code to figure out what you want to do:

Ask for ID:
if ID is not valid, keep entering
else ask for password
if password != pass, keep entering
else say ___________
…

Write it out like that and I’ll be able to help more

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ada:

Just type your words up in Microsoft Word first, then run a spell check

Firefox 2.0 has a built in spell checker.

And depending on what you want to do, ObjectOutputStream might be a good, easy way to handle your database.

item.title: Daterbaces and random picking of set numbers?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

well for 1 i dont like the piss taken outa me i am english well welsh just because i have a problem with spelling since i wos 14 i cant help that shit ill post the code for the program and yeo mite get what i meen

[code]import java.util.*;

public class Bull
{
public static void main (String[] args)
{

	int var1 = 0;
	int var2 = 0;
	int var3 = 0;
	int Manover = 5990;
	int pw = 83520;
	int de = 1234;
	Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

		System.out.print("what is your user id? :");
		var1 = input.nextInt();

		if (var1 == Manover)
		System.out.print("you have overwrited the system.\n the defalt pass set is 1234 please type it in. ");
		if (var1 == Manover)
		var3 = input.nextInt();


		if (var3 == de)
		System.out.println("\nhello the pass is " + pw + " \nhope you got that");

		else
		System.out.print("what is your user p.w.? :");
		var2 = input.nextInt();

		if (var2 == var1)
		System.out.println("\nhello the pass is " + pw + " \nhope you got that\n");

		else
		System.out.print("no chance \n");
	}
}

[/code]
